info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lunenburg, southern Nottoway, west central Dinwiddie and north central Brunswick Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Blackstone, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Blackstone around 325 PM EDT. Fort Barfoot around 330 PM EDT. Wilsons around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include North Wellville, Irby, Murdocks, Forkland, Darvills, Ordsburg, Wellville, Dominy Corner, Walkers, and Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
